title: How to Make Sriracha Carnitas in a Slow Cooker

steps.headline: Combine the 2 Tbsp Sriracha, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and salt in a small bowl.
steps.description: Mix it thoroughly until you have a paste.

steps.headline: Unwrap and trim the meat.
steps.description: Cut off any large areas of white fat. A little fat can add flavor but too much just ends up chewy and soft, so you'll want to remove any large chunks.

steps.headline: Drop your pork shoulder in your slow cooker.
steps.description: Spoon the paste on top and use your hands to rub it all over the outside of the pork, turning it so you cover all the sides.

steps.headline: Close your slow cooker and turn it on for 10 hours on low.
steps.description: Walk away and let it cook undisturbed.

steps.headline: Shred the fully cooked pork.
steps.description: When it's all done, it'll be easy to shred the pork with just a couple of forks. The meat should be sitting in a delicious, spicy sauce, and will fall apart easily.

steps.headline: Whip up a sauce, if desired.
steps.description: The carnitas are good as is, just in their own juices. However, if you want a little more flavor on the side, try a Sriracha-flavored mayo or a Sriracha sour cream. For the mayo, mix Sriracha, mayonnaise, and soy sauce, to taste. For the sour cream, mix about ¼ cup of sour cream with ½ to 1 Tbsp of Sriracha.

steps.headline: Serve it up!
steps.description: The carnitas go great in tacos. Warm up some corn tortillas in a frying pan, drop some carnitas in the middle of each tortilla, and add your preferred toppings. Try a little shredded cheese, some fresh chopped cilantro, a few slices of avocado, some sour cream, and some salsa or pico de gallo. If you really want to maximize the heat, add some more Sriracha!
